Description: Sherd of pottery vessel, mended from six fragments; preserved section is double-walled, both convex, with the outer wall given a series of vertical slits and holes through the centre of each resulting section; to the left bounding lines suggests there were diagonal slits there; thick yellowish slip on exterior; cross-hatching within roughly rectangular panels (triangular to left); bands above and below. Red-brown Nile silt fabric.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.059)
